item.title: [SPR-1287] cannot be resolved to absolute file path because it does not reside in the file system: Weblogic
item.description:
Hi All ,

I am using spring in EJBs and we are deploying the application on weblogic server on windows 2k os.
The application context is placed in the jar file and the jar is in ear.
When the ejb is loaded (onEjbCreate method) we are getting "cannot be resolved to absolute file path because it does not reside in the file system" error.

We deployed the same ear on jboss, there are no problems in loading the application context. The problem is only with weblogic. We are using beanRefContext.xml to define the application context. We are using ContextSingletonBeanFactoryLocator as BeanFactoryLocator. Application context is ClassPathXmlApplicationContext.

Contents of beanRefContext.xml :

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE beans PUBLIC "-//SPRING//DTD BEAN//EN" "http://www.springframework.org/dtd/spring-beans.dtd">
<beans>
<bean id="engine.applicationContext" lazy-init="true"
class="org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext">
<constructor-arg>
<value>classpath*:spring/applicationContext*.xml</value>
</constructor-arg>
</bean>
</beans>

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I've lowered the priority to "major", as this is not a blocker for the entire framework but rather just for classpath pattern matching on WebLogic (and even there only in special cases).

Anyway, thanks for the report! I have refined PathMatchingResourcePatternResolver to resort to URL file parsing for "jar:" and "zip:" resources without JarURLConnection. This should work for your scenario as well.

However, I haven't been able to reproduce the issue on WebLogic: I seem to always get "jar:" resources, never a "zip:" resource. Hence, it would be great if you could give one of the next nightly Spring snapshots a try and check whether the new fallback mechanism works for you!

Juergen

Hi Hoeller -

Can u please suggest us some work around to work with this. This is very urgent for us.
Today we have the delivery to the client.
Is there any way to change the initialization of the ZipUrlConnection in weblogic to use JarUrlConnection.

Thanks in advance.
Omkar

I've attached the current CVS version of PathMatchingResourcePatternResolver.java. Simply replace the file in the Spring 1.2.4 distribution (in src/org/springframework/core/io/support) with that new version, then call "build alljars" in the root of the distribution and grab the new spring.jar from the "dist" subdirectory.

Note that I haven't actually tested this against WebLogic's "zip:" prefix, just against local jar and zip files (with the JarURLConnection
check deactivated). So it would be great if you could verify whether this solution actually works for your scenario on WebLogic.

Juergen

Hi Hoeller -

Thanks for the fix. This is working in weblogic and it is tested.

Omkar

OK, thanks for the verification! This fix will be officially released in 1.2.5; nightly 1.2.5 snapshots are already available.

Juergen

Hi Juergen -

When can we expect the next official release.

Thanks,
Omkar
